I’m Sarah — a creator by blood, a developer by trade and an adventurer at heart.
I’m the Badass You Need to Hire:
After graduating from university, my dad gave me the best advice I’ve ever been given. He told me, “If you’re going to do something stupid, now is the time to do it.”

So last year, I moved to Mexico by myself equipped only with two suitcases and just enough Spanish to order tacos. The idea behind this adventure was not only fueled by the need to find the perfect taco, but by the desire to contribute something meaningful to the world.

While there, I was able to help better my students’ English-language skills and even helped some of them land jobs at major corporations like Kellogg in Mexico and in various positions here in the US.

However, living in Mexico was also the hardest thing I’ve done in my life so far. I had to make a fool of myself daily to get anything done, including navigating social interactions, figuring out transportation in a city of nearly 3 million people and simply buying food, which is harder than you might think.

But through all of the difficulties and hilariously embarrassing moments — like the time a taxi driver misunderstood my directions and I momentarily thought I was being kidnapped — I began to lose my self-conscious shell and thrive in all of the amazing experiences I was handed even if I had no idea what was going on. Every single day was an adventure, good and bad.

The point is I’m willing to take the necessary risks to achieve what I want and love a good challenge.
